prompt:
Please answer my code questions using the given API following this format: <<<api>>>: $API
<<<code>>>: $CODE
<<<explanation>>>: $EXPLANATION.
For API Iterator.next, the API usage rule is: Get the next element from an Iterator if it has more elements.

Question: Removing object from ArrayList in for each loop: :I would like to remove an object from an ArrayList when I'm done with it, but I can't find way to do it. Trying to remove it like in the sample code below doesn't want to work. How could I get to the iterator of current px object in this loop to remove it?    for( Pixel px : pixel){ [...]  if(px.y > gHeigh){     pixel.remove(pixel.indexOf(px)); // here is the thing     pixel.remove(px); //doesn't work either  }}
Please using this api: Iterator.next.
Answer:
response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: Iterator<Pixel> iterator = pixel.iterator();
while (iterator.hasNext()) {
    Pixel px = iterator.next();
    if (px.y > gHeigh) {
        iterator.remove();
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: To remove an object from an ArrayList while iterating over it, you can use an Iterator. First, obtain an Iterator object by calling the iterator() method on the ArrayList. Then, use a while loop to iterate over the elements using the hasNext() method of the Iterator. Inside the loop, use the next() method to get the next element. If the condition is met, call the remove() method on the Iterator to remove the current element. This will remove the element from the ArrayList without causing any ConcurrentModificationException.
